snippet.title: Super Smash Bros  Deluxe Overview + Release
snippet.description:
Update! Here is version 2.0: https://youtu.be/2XjYawInzj0

Below here is the unpacked version 1.1, for those of you that know what you're doing and can make tweaks of your own (word of warning though, adding much of anything (regardless of the type of content) right now without removing anything will cause this thing to freeze every time at the character select screen (at least on official Wii U hardware, you'd have to verify via emulation), this thing has pretty much reached the limits that modern Smash Wii U hacking can achieve at this time:
https://mega.nz/#!BiwFkJrB!BJi62shXqfPo3FoYXtG_SnC7TSBgxNOB78B8o69BAKs

The 1.1 update includes a few minor fixes, and a few great skins I missed out on but some commentors exposed me to, I had to remove a few to make way for these new skins, but I only got rid of less exciting ones that few would miss: 

Otherwise download the exact same version of  Super Smash Bros. Deluxe shown off in this video here: https://mega.nz/#!V2piFT5Z!4wWAk7JN4Izl1QfQX-tInNzPx-FeSQWNvbrj2fW3mB4

Thanks to everyone whose work was utilized within this modpack.  Please enjoy and spread the word.  Enjoy a refresh of Smash for the Wii U as we wait in the coming months for Smash on the Switch.  

The included readme should cover any questions you have, but if you have any more, comment here or look up elsewhere how to hack your Wii U and how to use things like SDCafiine and ftpiiU.

I apologize that the audio gets slightly desynced and that the audio on the screens with just words is louder, I thought I had fixed this, but I'm realizing I may not have saved that change.  Given the point of this video though, I think you'll all survive these light audio issues to actually see the purpose of this video in question.
